entity.name: ComputeProtocol
entity.description: Executable definitions of computational 'protocols' of analysis. For example: bwa-align. Therefore the Protocol class is extended:

field.name: scriptTemplate
field.description: Commandline or (template of) an script, e.g. in bash, R. Templating engine is freemarker.

field.name: scriptInterpreter
field.description: the interpreter used to run this script. For example 'bash'

field.name: requirements
field.description: requirements of the compation.

field.name: walltime
field.description: # the expected maximum runtime of this job. Notation: 'dd:hh:mm'

field.name: mem
field.description: # PBS memory argument (e.g. 512mb, 4gb)

field.name: cores
field.description: # required cores

field.name: nodes
field.description: # required nodes

entity.name: ComputeParameter
entity.description: Parameter are the inputs or outputs into an ComputeProtocol.

field.name: defaultValue
field.description: the value of the parameter for ComputeProtocols

field.name: hasOne
field.description: relationship between parameters, enables parameter 'flattening'

field.name: Workflow
field.description: Workflow this element is part of

entity.name: Workflow
entity.description: A workflow is a plan to execute a series of subprotocols in a particular order. Each workflow elements is another protocol as refered to via WorkflowElement. Because Workflow extends Protocol, workflows can be nested just as any other protocol.

entity.name: WorkflowElement
entity.description: Elements of a workflow are references to protocols. The whole workflow is a directed graph with each element pointing to the previousSteps that the current workflow element depends on.

field.name: Workflow
field.description: Workflow this element is part of

field.name: protocol
field.description: Protocol to be used at this workflow step

field.name: PreviousSteps
field.description: Previous steps that need to be done before this protocol can be executed.

entity.name: ComputeTask
entity.description: A protocolApplication that reports the application of running a ComputeProtocol.

field.name: ComputeScript
field.description: The actual command to be sent to the cluster, is a filled in version of the one define in the ComputeProtocol

field.name: RunLog
field.description: Log of the task execution

field.name: WorkflowElement
field.description: Reference to the workflow element that generated this script.

field.name: Interpreter
field.description: the interpreter used to run this command. For example 'shellTemplate'

field.name: PrevSteps
field.description: To keep track of calculation dependencies

field.name: requirements
field.description: requirements of the compation.

field.name: StatusCode
field.description: last known status of this task. See compute history for details.

entity.name: ComputeHistory
entity.description: Keep track of the compute history of a task, including resubmissions. One worker may process multiple tasks.

field.name: ComputeTask
field.description: the task for which the history was collected

field.name: ComputeWorker
field.description: the worker that (tried to) execute(d) this task

field.name: StatusCode
field.description: current status of this task.

field.name: StatusTime
field.description: time of state change

field.name: OutputFile
field.description: content of the output file (only applicable on fail/done of a task)

field.name: ErrorFile
field.description: field to show the content of the error file (only applicable on fail/done of a task)

entity.name: ComputeWorker
entity.description: Worker on the remote system. This can be pilot job or traditional job. A worker executes the tasks (one or more). Each worker gets a unique name.

field.name: computeHost
field.description: the host for this worker

field.name: hostJobId
field.description: job id on the host

field.name: startTime
field.description: time running started (to calculate time remaining)

field.name: lastActivity
field.description: when we received last activity from this worker

field.name: StatusCode
field.description: current status of this task.

field.name: requirements
field.description: requirements of the computation.

entity.name: ComputeHost
entity.description: Declaration of a compute resource, including username and password

field.name: hostName
field.description: ssh host of the headnode of this grid, cluster or standalone worker.

field.name: hostType
field.description: type of the host

field.name: hostDir
field.description: working directory on the remote host. This is were the scripts will be put

field.name: hostQueue
field.description: the queue of the remote system, if applicable.

field.name: hostUsername
field.description: username on the remote system. Should be protected!!!

field.name: hostPassword
field.description: password on the remote cluster. Should be protected!!!
